node.title: 85-Year-Old Man Who Drove Over and Killed Romantic Rival Sentenced to 10 Years in Prison
node.description: Johnny Westbrook pleaded guilty before Judge Ellen Torregrossa-O'Connor to aggravated manslaughter to a hit-and-run that occurred three years ago.

node.title: Man Dubbed 'I-4 Bandit' Charged in Florida Holdup Months After Prison Release
node.description: Months after being released from prison for several 1990s bank robberies in Florida, David Ratcliff was arrested Tuesday, accused in a holdup.

node.title: Families of Astroworld Concert Victims Decline Travis Scott's Offer to Pay for Funerals
node.description: Several other families have joined the family of 9-year-old Ezra Blount in rejecting the offer, saying they want to see Scott held accountable in other ways.

node.title: Hard-Hit Brazil Sees First Cases of Omicron Variant, Pair of Travelers From South Africa
node.description: The travelers arrived in Brazil on Nov. 23 and took a PCR test before they planned to return to South Africa two days later, the secretariat statement said.

node.title: Ripe cherries look like this after record rain. What will it mean for Christmas?
node.description: Cherry growers warn consumers may have to pay more for the fruit this Christmas, as unseasonally heavy,  widespread rain wreaks havoc in several growing regions.

node.title: Australia's economic decline smaller than feared during latest east coast lockdowns
node.description: Australia's economy posts its third biggest fall on record, but the result is much better than economists had feared amid lockdowns across Australia's south-east corner.

node.title: Ardie Savea to stay with All Blacks and Hurricanes
node.description: All Blacks loose forward Ardie Savea has signed a four-year deal with New Zealand Rugby (NZR) which will keep him in Aotearoa until the end of 2025.

node.title: Who is the new National Party leader Christopher Luxon?
node.description: Analysis - Christopher Luxon is considered both an unknown quantity and something of a messiah for the National Party.

node.title: RNZ launches new platform for rangatahi
node.description: RNZ has this morning unveiled a new digital platform for rangatahi, sharing the music, stories and culture of Aotearoa. Video

node.title: Employers lagging behind on support for menopausal women
node.description: Advocates are calling for more support for working women going through menopause.

node.title: WHO says people who are above 60 and unvaccinated should postpone travel
node.description: WHO named Omicron a variant of concern on Friday, and 56 countries issued travel restrictions in the following days.

node.title: Trump’s Iran Policy Has Become a Disaster for the U.S. and Israel
node.description: Withdrawing from the Iran nuclear deal was a mistake. What comes next?

node.title: Let’s End the Covid Blame Games
node.description: Finger pointing is pointless, divisive and dumb.

node.title: School shootings are becoming more frequent, after a lull during the pandemic.
node.description: The deadly gunfire in Oxford, Mich., added one more episode to a growing list of fatal shootings on school property in the United States this year.

node.title: Josh Duggar of ‘19 Kids and Counting’ Goes on Trial in Child Pornography Case
node.description: Prosecutors say Mr. Duggar used the internet to download explicit material showing the sexual abuse of children. He faces up to 40 years in prison if convicted.

node.title: Republican Recriminations Point to a Rocky Path to a House Majority
node.description: Simmering tensions between the far-right flank and more traditional conservatives burst into the open on Tuesday, while Republican leaders stayed silent.

node.title: College Football Playoff Rankings Released 11/30/2021: Georgia Still No. 1
node.description: The Cincinnati Bearcats remain in the top 4 for a playoff spot with one weekend of regular season to go.

node.title: Man Accused of Killing His 4 Children, Mother-in-Law Often Posted About Living Religiously
node.description: A man charged with killing his four children and mother-in-law is expected to appear in court on Tuesday.

node.title: Chris Cuomo Suspended at CNN Following New York AG's Release of Text Messages
node.description: "These documents point to a greater level of involvement in his brother's efforts than we previously knew," a CNN spokesperson said.

node.title: Community Raises $75K to Help 75-Year-Old College Adviser Buy First Home
node.description: Lyllye Reynolds-Parker was able to buy her dream home after the community at University of Oregon raised the money since she had done so much for the students.

node.title: LA Sheriff Refuses County's COVID Testing Over Alleged China Connection to Test Provider
node.description: LA Sheriff Alex Villaneuva released a letter to the County Board of Supervisors contesting the use of Fulgent Genetics testing because of alleged ties to China.

node.title: According to Māori legend, this giant eagle could swoop down and carry off adults and children
node.description: A Māori legend of a big bird capable of killing humans was very close to the bone, a study finds.

node.title: Clare Wheeler proves timing is key in Matildas' draw with USA
node.description: If elite sport is about grabbing opportunities when they come, then Clare Wheeler's Matildas appearance against the USA is a prime example, writes Samantha Lewis.

node.title: Likely new Omicron case found in NSW, hundreds of COVID-19 swabs to be retested
node.description: NSW Health Minister Brad Hazzard says a sixth case of the Omicron COVID-19 variant has likely been discovered in the state.

node.title: Schools relying on employees to work multiple jobs amid staffing crisis
node.description: In Denver, a district-wide mental health day was implemented to help alleviate burnout.

node.title: Alice Sebold Apologizes to Man Wrongly Convicted of Raping Her
node.description: Anthony Broadwater spent 16 years in prison after the author identified him as her attacker in an assault she described in her memoir “Lucky.”

node.title: Florida Bill Will Require Schools to Teach Benefits, Risks of Social Media
node.description: The bill, sponsored by Republican Senator Danny Burgess, was passed unanimously by the Senate Education Committee.

node.title: BuzzFeed Gets Legal Victory in Fight for Release of Redacted Sections of Mueller Report
node.description: The FOIA attorney for Buzzfeed News said the court's decision "reaffirms the public's right to understand how the government makes important decisions."

node.title: National gambles on political novice to reunite caucus
node.description: A bruising four years has left National's caucus broken and divided - but they are striving for unity. Audio

node.title: CNN suspends Chris Cuomo over texts with Andrew Cuomo's team
node.description: The suspension comes one day after New York attorney general Letitia James released a series of text messages between him and Andrew Cuomo's top aide.
